item.title: EU Imposes Asset Freezes, Visa Bans On Hamas Financiers
item.description: The European Union on Friday imposed asset freezes and visa bans on several firms and individuals accused of helping to finance Palestinian Islamist group Hamas, Brussels said.

item.title: Wealthy French make post-election contingency plans - Financial Times
item.description:
1. Wealthy French make post-election contingency plans  Financial Times
  2. Isolated Macron Braces For French Voters' 'Revenge'  Barron's
  3. What France’s Surprise Elections Could Mean for Its Relations with the World  War On The Rocks
  4. France's election has the ability to rock wider European stocks, Citi strategist says  CNBC
  5. France's Far Right at the Gates of Power  The New York Times

item.title: Lib Dems have regained trust of voters after coalition years, says Ed Davey
item.description:
Leader tells BBC he was ‘not proud’ of every decision he took in government from 2010 to 2015 and had made sure his party listened to voters again

  • UK election live – latest updates

The Liberal Democrats have won back the trust of voters after being in coalition with the Conservatives and U-turning on university tuition fees, Ed Davey has said.

Speaking to the BBC’s Nick Robinson, who is interviewing all the main party leaders, Davey said one of the main aims of his time as leader had been to listen again to voters after three disappointing elections in a row.

Continue reading...

item.title: Ed Davey says health and care ‘right at the centre’ of Lib Dem manifesto
item.description:
Liberal Democrats leader is speaking to the BBC’s Nick Robinson as election campaigning enters its final days

  • Sign up to our Election Edition daily newsletter

Here’s the latest in the Guardian’s series on The broken years: Tory Britain 2010-24:

Unless the polls are wildly inaccurate, the Conservative party is heading towards a catastrophic defeat in the coming election.

Continue reading...
